clause_text: Mrs. Baker was known for adopting many cats in the narrator's neighborhood.
Mrs. Baker's grandson had poor manners which affected the narrator's perception of him.
Mrs. Baker's poorly mannered grandson attempted to befriend me and threatened to run away, leading to a situation where I had to help search for him.
Mrs. Baker's poorly mannered grandson attempted to befriend the narrator and threatened to run away, leading to a search.
Mrs. Baker's grandson pretended to run away but was found in a treehouse.

The narrator recounts an incident from childhood involving Mrs. Baker's grandson pretending to run away, leading to a search and advice from Officer Dawson to stay out of sight due to Mrs. Baker's persistent nature.
